userreviews.userReview: This was a really odd story and I don't even remember why I bought it in the first place, but it's neither like the 1980's film or the cartoon TV series, really. It was more weird and goofy than anything else and I just kind of got bored with it and gave it to my little brother, who's probably its more appropriate age demographic, anyway. I did like the characters, they were quirky and unique as usual in the rest of the Beetlejuice legacy, but I think this book was written as a promotional bit of merchandise and wasn't really meant to be more than some quick entertainment.

description: Based on one of the most memorable fantasy characters to appear on TV and movie screens in years, this series is guaranteed to scare readers silly. In this madcap adventure starring the ghoul of gags and his dramatic best friend Lydia, the wacky duo make a ghost rock video.
title: Rock 'n' Roll Nightmare (Beetlejuice 3): Rock 'n' Roll Nightmare
